intro: Retiniphyllum angustiflorum, commonly known as the narrow-flower retiniphyllum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
